Interface Turtle

public interface Turtle

The superclass (interface) that defines the capabilities shared by every turtle.

Author:
Ilkka Kokkarinen

Method Summary
abstract  java.awt.Graphics2D getGraphics2D()
          Get the Graphics2D object that this turtle draws on.
abstract  double getHeading()
          Get the absolute heading of the turtle.
abstract  double getX()
          Get the x-coordinate of the absolute position of the turtle.
abstract  double getY()
          Get the y-coordinate of the absolute position of the turtle.
abstract  void move(double dist)
          Move the turtle forward the given distance.
abstract  void popState()
          Pop the previous state of the turtle (containing the absolute position and the absolute heading) from the internal stack, making the turtle to return to that position.
abstract  void pushState()
          Push the current state of the turtle (containing the absolute position and the absolute heading) to the internal stack.
abstract  void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
          Set the current drawing color to use in drawing when the pen is down.
abstract  void setGraphics2D(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
          Set the Graphics2D object that this turtle draws on.
abstract  void setHeading(double angle)
          Set the absolute heading of the turtle.
abstract  void setPen(boolean down)
          Set the state of the pen.
abstract  void setPosition(double x, double y)
          Set the absolute position of the turtle.
abstract  void setStroke(java.awt.Stroke stroke)
          Set the current stroke to be used in drawing when the pen is down.
abstract  void turn(double turnAngle)
          Turn the turtle in place the given angle, measured in degrees.

getGraphics2D

java.awt.Graphics2D getGraphics2D()
Get the Graphics2D object that this turtle draws on.

Returns:
The Graphics2D object that this turtle draws on.

getHeading

double getHeading()
Get the absolute heading of the turtle.

Returns:
The absolute heading of the turtle.

double getX()
Get the x-coordinate of the absolute position of the turtle.

Returns:
The x-coordinate of the absolute position of the turtle.

getY

double getY()
Get the y-coordinate of the absolute position of the turtle.

Returns:
The y-coordinate of the absolute position of the turtle.

move

void move(double dist)
Move the turtle forward the given distance.

Parameters:
dist - The distance to move forward.

popState

void popState()
Pop the previous state of the turtle (containing the absolute position and the absolute heading) from the internal stack, making the turtle to return to that position.

pushState

void pushState()
Push the current state of the turtle (containing the absolute position and the absolute heading) to the internal stack.

setColor

void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
Set the current drawing color to use in drawing when the pen is down.

Parameters:
color - The current drawing color to use.

setGraphics2D

void setGraphics2D(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Set the Graphics2D object that this turtle draws on.

Parameters:
g - The Graphics2D object that this turtle draws on.

setHeading

void setHeading(double angle)
Set the absolute heading of the turtle. The spirit of turtle graphics is to call this method only once in the beginning, after which you only use the relative motion operations.

Parameters:
angle - The absolute heading angle of the turtle, expressed in degrees with 0 pointing right and 90 pointing up.

setPen

void setPen(boolean down)
Set the state of the pen. When the pen is down, the turtle leaves some kind of drawing behind its movement, and when the pen is up, the turtle moves without drawing anything.

Parameters:
down - Whether the pen is currently down.

setPosition

void setPosition(double x,
                 double y)
Set the absolute position of the turtle. The spirit of turtle graphics is to call this method only once in the beginning, after which you only use the relative motion operations.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of the absolute position.
y - The y-coordinate of the absolute position.

setStroke

void setStroke(java.awt.Stroke stroke)
Set the current stroke to be used in drawing when the pen is down.

Parameters:
stroke - The current stroke to use in drawing.

turn

void turn(double turnAngle)
Turn the turtle in place the given angle, measured in degrees. Positive angle turns the turtle left, while a negative angle turns it right.

Parameters:
turnAngle - The angle to turn.
